name: Perfect Building and Loan Association v. Mandel et ux., Appellants
name_abbreviation: Perfect Building & Loan Ass'n v. Mandel

judges: Before Schaffer, C. J.; Maxey, Drew, Linn, Stern, Patterson and Parker, JJ.
parties: Perfect Building and Loan Association v. Mandel et ux., Appellants.

opinions.text:
Per Curiam,
This appeal is from the refusal to open a judgment entered on a warrant in a bond accompanying a mortgage. A responsive answer was filed to the petition. Depositions were taken by both sides. The proceeding is equitable in character and determined by the application of principles of equity with the result that the conclusion of the court passing on the case will not be disturbed unless there is obvious error. The record amply supports the discharge of the rule to open.
Judgment affirmed.
opinions.author: Per Curiam,

attorneys: B. D. OUensis, and Hyman Lebovitz, for appellees, were not heard.
casebody.head_matter:
Perfect Building and Loan Association v. Mandel et ux., Appellants.
Argued November 27,1942.
Before Schaffer, C. J.; Maxey, Drew, Linn, Stern, Patterson and Parker, JJ.
Maurice E. Cohen, for appellants.
B. D. OUensis, and Hyman Lebovitz, for appellees, were not heard.
January 4,1943:
